newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Police clash with worshippers at Bahraini mosques.
newsitem.headline: Police clash with worshippers at Bahraini mosques.

text.p: Riot police clashed with worshippers near mosques in Bahrain over the weekend and arrested several people, an opposition group said on Saturday.
"Riot police carried out acts of aggression against worshippers at Ras Roman mosque on Friday," the London-based Islamic Freedom Movement said in a statement.
"They beat and arrested a large number of citizens after noon prayers," the statement said.
A Bahraini government official told Reuters police had dispersed a group of people who had gathered near the mosque in the capital Manama, but gave no details.

The opposition statement said police also clashed with worshippers at a mosque in the Shi'ite village of Daih, five km (three miles) west of Manama, on Thursday after women staged a demonstration in the nearby village of Sanabis.
It said the demonstrators were demanding the release of Sheikh Abdul-Amir al-Jamri, a prominent Shi'ite clergyman and a former member of parliament, who was detained 11 months ago.
Around 27 people have been killed in two years of sporadic unrest by members of Bahrain's majority Shi'ite Moslem community seeking political and economic reforms.
Hundreds of people have also been detained in connection with waves of violence, arson attacks and protests.
